text: Auramine O is a synthetic fluorescent dye widely used in the field of microbiology, particularly for the detection of acid-fast bacteria. Developed as part of the Ziehl-Neelsen staining method, this dye plays a role in the identification and diagnosis of infectious diseases caused by microorganisms with resistant cell walls, such as Mycobacterium tuberculosis. Category:Aromatic compounds Category:Dyes
title: Auramine O
